00036 // The following macro "BT_NOT_EMPTY_FILE" can be put into a file
00037 // in order suppress the MS Visual C++ Linker warning 4221
00038 //
00039 // warning LNK4221: no public symbols found; archive member will be inaccessible
00040 //
00041 // This warning occurs on PC and XBOX when a file compiles out completely
00042 // has no externally visible symbols which may be dependant on configuration
00043 // #defines and options.
00044 //
00045 // see more https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1822887/what-is-the-best-way-to-eliminate-ms-visual-c-linker-warning-warning-lnk422
00046 
00047 #if defined (_MSC_VER)
00048         #define BT_NOT_EMPTY_FILE_CAT_II(p, res) res
00049         #define BT_NOT_EMPTY_FILE_CAT_I(a, b) BT_NOT_EMPTY_FILE_CAT_II(~, a ## b)
00050         #define BT_NOT_EMPTY_FILE_CAT(a, b) BT_NOT_EMPTY_FILE_CAT_I(a, b)
00051         #define BT_NOT_EMPTY_FILE namespace { char BT_NOT_EMPTY_FILE_CAT(NoEmptyFileDummy, __COUNTER__); }
00052 #else
00053         #define BT_NOT_EMPTY_FILE 
00054 #endif

00322         #ifndef BT_NO_SIMD_OPERATOR_OVERLOADS
00323         inline __m128 operator+(const __m128 A, const __m128 B)
00324         {
00325                 return _mm_add_ps(A, B);
00326         }
00327 
00328         inline __m128 operator-(const __m128 A, const __m128 B)
00329         {
00330                 return _mm_sub_ps(A, B);
00331         }
00332 
00333         inline __m128 operator*(const __m128 A, const __m128 B)
00334         {
00335                 return _mm_mul_ps(A, B);
00336         }

00371         struct btInfMaskConverter
00372         {
00373                 union {
00374                         float mask;
00375                         int intmask;
00376                 };
00377                 btInfMaskConverter(int _mask = 0x7F800000)
00378                         : intmask(_mask)
00379                 {
00380                 }
00381         };
00382         static btInfMaskConverter btInfinityMask = 0x7F800000;
00383         #define BT_INFINITY (btInfinityMask.mask)
00384         inline int btGetInfinityMask()  //suppress stupid compiler warning
00385         {
00386                 return btInfinityMask.intmask;

00403 #define BT_DECLARE_ALIGNED_ALLOCATOR()                                                                     \
00404         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void *operator new(size_t sizeInBytes) { return btAlignedAlloc(sizeInBytes, 16); }   \
00405         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void operator delete(void *ptr) { btAlignedFree(ptr); }                              \
00406         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void *operator new(size_t, void *ptr) { return ptr; }                                \
00407         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void operator delete(void *, void *) {}                                              \
00408         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void *operator new[](size_t sizeInBytes) { return btAlignedAlloc(sizeInBytes, 16); } \
00409         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void operator delete[](void *ptr) { btAlignedFree(ptr); }                            \
00410         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void *operator new[](size_t, void *ptr) { return ptr; }                              \
00411         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void operator delete[](void *, void *) {}

00415         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btSqrt(btScalar x)
00416         {
00417                 return sqrt(x);
00418         }
00419         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btFabs(btScalar x) { return fabs(x); }
00420         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btCos(btScalar x) { return cos(x); }
00421         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btSin(btScalar x) { return sin(x); }
00422         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btTan(btScalar x) { return tan(x); }
00423         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btAcos(btScalar x)
00424         {
00425                 if (x < btScalar(-1)) x = btScalar(-1);
00426                 if (x > btScalar(1)) x = btScalar(1);
00427                 return acos(x);
00428         }
00429         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btAsin(btScalar x)
00430         {
00431                 if (x < btScalar(-1)) x = btScalar(-1);
00432                 if (x > btScalar(1)) x = btScalar(1);
00433                 return asin(x);
00434         }
00435         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btAtan(btScalar x) { return atan(x); }
00436         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btAtan2(btScalar x, btScalar y) { return atan2(x, y); }
00437         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btExp(btScalar x) { return exp(x); }
00438         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btLog(btScalar x) { return log(x); }
00439         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btPow(btScalar x, btScalar y) { return pow(x, y); }
00440         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btFmod(btScalar x, btScalar y) { return fmod(x, y); }
00441 
00442 #else//BT_USE_DOUBLE_PRECISION
00443 
00444         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btSqrt(btScalar y)
00445         {
00446         #ifdef USE_APPROXIMATION
00447         #ifdef __LP64__
00448                 float xhalf = 0.5f * y;
00449                 int i = *(int *)&y;
00450                 i = 0x5f375a86 - (i >> 1);
00451                 y = *(float *)&i;
00452                 y = y * (1.5f - xhalf * y * y);
00453                 y = y * (1.5f - xhalf * y * y);
00454                 y = y * (1.5f - xhalf * y * y);
00455                 y = 1 / y;
00456                 return y;
00457         #else
00458                 double x, z, tempf;
00459                 unsigned long *tfptr = ((unsigned long *)&tempf) + 1;
00460                 tempf = y;
00461                 *tfptr = (0xbfcdd90a - *tfptr) >> 1; /* estimate of 1/sqrt(y) */
00462                 x = tempf;
00463                 z = y * btScalar(0.5);
00464                 x = (btScalar(1.5) * x) - (x * x) * (x * z); /* iteration formula     */
00465                 x = (btScalar(1.5) * x) - (x * x) * (x * z);
00466                 x = (btScalar(1.5) * x) - (x * x) * (x * z);
00467                 x = (btScalar(1.5) * x) - (x * x) * (x * z);
00468                 x = (btScalar(1.5) * x) - (x * x) * (x * z);
00469                 return x * y;
00470         #endif
00471         #else
00472                 return sqrtf(y);
00473         #endif
00474         }
00475         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btFabs(btScalar x) { return fabsf(x); }
00476         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btCos(btScalar x) { return cosf(x); }
00477         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btSin(btScalar x) { return sinf(x); }
00478         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btTan(btScalar x) { return tanf(x); }
00479         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btAcos(btScalar x)
00480         {
00481                 if (x < btScalar(-1))
00482                         x = btScalar(-1);
00483                 if (x > btScalar(1))
00484                         x = btScalar(1);
00485                 return acosf(x);
00486         }
00487         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btAsin(btScalar x)
00488         {
00489                 if (x < btScalar(-1))
00490                         x = btScalar(-1);
00491                 if (x > btScalar(1))
00492                         x = btScalar(1);
00493                 return asinf(x);
00494         }
00495         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btAtan(btScalar x) { return atanf(x); }
00496         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btAtan2(btScalar x, btScalar y) { return atan2f(x, y); }
00497         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btExp(btScalar x) { return expf(x); }
00498         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btLog(btScalar x) { return logf(x); }
00499         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btPow(btScalar x, btScalar y) { return powf(x, y); }
00500         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btFmod(btScalar x, btScalar y) { return fmodf(x, y); }
00501 
00502 #endif//BT_USE_DOUBLE_PRECISION

00504 #define SIMD_PI btScalar(3.1415926535897932384626433832795029)
00505 #define SIMD_2_PI (btScalar(2.0) * SIMD_PI)
00506 #define SIMD_HALF_PI (SIMD_PI * btScalar(0.5))
00507 #define SIMD_RADS_PER_DEG (SIMD_2_PI / btScalar(360.0))
00508 #define SIMD_DEGS_PER_RAD (btScalar(360.0) / SIMD_2_PI)
00509 #define SIMDSQRT12 btScalar(0.7071067811865475244008443621048490)
00510 #define btRecipSqrt(x) ((btScalar)(btScalar(1.0) / btSqrt(btScalar(x)))) /* reciprocal square root */
00511 #define btRecip(x) (btScalar(1.0) / btScalar(x))

00516         #define BT_ONE 1.0
00517         #define BT_ZERO 0.0
00518         #define BT_TWO 2.0
00519         #define BT_HALF 0.5

00523         #define BT_ONE 1.0f

00530 
00531 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btAtan2Fast(btScalar y, btScalar x)
00532 {
00533         btScalar coeff_1 = SIMD_PI / 4.0f;
00534         btScalar coeff_2 = 3.0f * coeff_1;
00535         btScalar abs_y = btFabs(y);
00536         btScalar angle;
00537         if (x >= 0.0f)
00538         {
00539                 btScalar r = (x - abs_y) / (x + abs_y);
00540                 angle = coeff_1 - coeff_1 * r;
00541         }
00542         else
00543         {
00544                 btScalar r = (x + abs_y) / (abs_y - x);
00545                 angle = coeff_2 - coeff_1 * r;
00546         }
00547         return (y < 0.0f) ? -angle : angle;
00548 }

00552 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool btEqual(btScalar a, btScalar eps)
00553 {
00554         return (((a) <= eps) && !((a) < -eps));
00555 }
00556 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool btGreaterEqual(btScalar a, btScalar eps)
00557 {
00558         return (!((a) <= eps));
00559 }

00562 {
00563         return x < btScalar(0.0) ? 1 : 0;
00564 }

00575 #ifndef btFsel
00576 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btFsel(btScalar a, btScalar b, btScalar c)
00577 {
00578         return a >= 0 ? b : c;
00579 }
00580 #endif
00581 #define btFsels(a, b, c) (btScalar) btFsel(a, b, c)

00583 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool btMachineIsLittleEndian()
00584 {
00585         long int i = 1;
00586         const char *p = (const char *)&i;
00587         if (p[0] == 1)  // Lowest address contains the least significant byte
00588                 return true;
00589         else
00590                 return false;
00591 }
00592 
00595 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE unsigned btSelect(unsigned condition, unsigned valueIfConditionNonZero, unsigned valueIfConditionZero)
00596 {
00597         // Set testNz to 0xFFFFFFFF if condition is nonzero, 0x00000000 if condition is zero
00598         // Rely on positive value or'ed with its negative having sign bit on
00599         // and zero value or'ed with its negative (which is still zero) having sign bit off
00600         // Use arithmetic shift right, shifting the sign bit through all 32 bits
00601         unsigned testNz = (unsigned)(((int)condition | -(int)condition) >> 31);
00602         unsigned testEqz = ~testNz;
00603         return ((valueIfConditionNonZero & testNz) | (valueIfConditionZero & testEqz));
00604 }
00605 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE int btSelect(unsigned condition, int valueIfConditionNonZero, int valueIfConditionZero)
00606 {
00607         unsigned testNz = (unsigned)(((int)condition | -(int)condition) >> 31);
00608         unsigned testEqz = ~testNz;
00609         return static_cast<int>((valueIfConditionNonZero & testNz) | (valueIfConditionZero & testEqz));
00610 }
00611 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE float btSelect(unsigned condition, float valueIfConditionNonZero, float valueIfConditionZero)
00612 {
00613 #ifdef BT_HAVE_NATIVE_FSEL
00614         return (float)btFsel((btScalar)condition - btScalar(1.0f), valueIfConditionNonZero, valueIfConditionZero);
00615 #else
00616         return (condition != 0) ? valueIfConditionNonZero : valueIfConditionZero;
00617 #endif
00618 }

00620 template <typename T>
00621 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void btSwap(T &a, T &b)
00622 {
00623         T tmp = a;
00624         a = b;
00625         b = tmp;
00626 }

00628 //PCK: endian swapping functions
00629 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE unsigned btSwapEndian(unsigned val)
00630 {
00631         return (((val & 0xff000000) >> 24) | ((val & 0x00ff0000) >> 8) | ((val & 0x0000ff00) << 8) | ((val & 0x000000ff) << 24));
00632 }
00633 
00634 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE unsigned short btSwapEndian(unsigned short val)
00635 {
00636         return static_cast<unsigned short>(((val & 0xff00) >> 8) | ((val & 0x00ff) << 8));
00637 }
00638 
00639 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE unsigned btSwapEndian(int val)
00640 {
00641         return btSwapEndian((unsigned)val);
00642 }
00643 
00644 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE unsigned short btSwapEndian(short val)
00645 {
00646         return btSwapEndian((unsigned short)val);
00647 }

00655 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE unsigned int btSwapEndianFloat(float d)
00656 {
00657         unsigned int a = 0;
00658         unsigned char *dst = (unsigned char *)&a;
00659         unsigned char *src = (unsigned char *)&d;
00660 
00661         dst[0] = src[3];
00662         dst[1] = src[2];
00663         dst[2] = src[1];
00664         dst[3] = src[0];
00665         return a;
00666 }
00667 
00668 // unswap using char pointers
00669 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE float btUnswapEndianFloat(unsigned int a)
00670 {
00671         float d = 0.0f;
00672         unsigned char *src = (unsigned char *)&a;
00673         unsigned char *dst = (unsigned char *)&d;
00674 
00675         dst[0] = src[3];
00676         dst[1] = src[2];
00677         dst[2] = src[1];
00678         dst[3] = src[0];
00679 
00680         return d;
00681 }
00682 
00683 // swap using char pointers
00684 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void btSwapEndianDouble(double d, unsigned char *dst)
00685 {
00686         unsigned char *src = (unsigned char *)&d;
00687 
00688         dst[0] = src[7];
00689         dst[1] = src[6];
00690         dst[2] = src[5];
00691         dst[3] = src[4];
00692         dst[4] = src[3];
00693         dst[5] = src[2];
00694         dst[6] = src[1];
00695         dst[7] = src[0];
00696 }
00697 
00698 // unswap using char pointers
00699 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE double btUnswapEndianDouble(const unsigned char *src)
00700 {
00701         double d = 0.0;
00702         unsigned char *dst = (unsigned char *)&d;
00703 
00704         dst[0] = src[7];
00705         dst[1] = src[6];
00706         dst[2] = src[5];
00707         dst[3] = src[4];
00708         dst[4] = src[3];
00709         dst[5] = src[2];
00710         dst[6] = src[1];
00711         dst[7] = src[0];
00712 
00713         return d;
00714 }

00716 template <typename T>
00717 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void btSetZero(T *a, int n)
00718 {
00719         T *acurr = a;
00720         size_t ncurr = n;
00721         while (ncurr > 0)
00722         {
00723                 *(acurr++) = 0;
00724                 --ncurr;
00725         }
00726 }
00727 
00728 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btLargeDot(const btScalar *a, const btScalar *b, int n)
00729 {
00730         btScalar p0, q0, m0, p1, q1, m1, sum;
00731         sum = 0;
00732         n -= 2;
00733         while (n >= 0)
00734         {
00735                 p0 = a[0];
00736                 q0 = b[0];
00737                 m0 = p0 * q0;
00738                 p1 = a[1];
00739                 q1 = b[1];
00740                 m1 = p1 * q1;
00741                 sum += m0;
00742                 sum += m1;
00743                 a += 2;
00744                 b += 2;
00745                 n -= 2;
00746         }
00747         n += 2;
00748         while (n > 0)
00749         {
00750                 sum += (*a) * (*b);
00751                 a++;
00752                 b++;
00753                 n--;
00754         }
00755         return sum;
00756 }
00757 
00758 // returns normalized value in range [-SIMD_PI, SIMD_PI]
00759 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar btNormalizeAngle(btScalar angleInRadians)
00760 {
00761         angleInRadians = btFmod(angleInRadians, SIMD_2_PI);
00762         if (angleInRadians < -SIMD_PI)
00763         {
00764                 return angleInRadians + SIMD_2_PI;
00765         }
00766         else if (angleInRadians > SIMD_PI)
00767         {
00768                 return angleInRadians - SIMD_2_PI;
00769         }
00770         else
00771         {
00772                 return angleInRadians;
00773         }
00774 }

00783         int m_objectType;
00784         inline int getObjectType() const
00785         {
00786                 return m_objectType;
00787         }
00788 };

00791 template <typename T>
00792 T *btAlignPointer(T *unalignedPtr, size_t alignment)
00793 {
00794         struct btConvertPointerSizeT
00795         {
00796                 union {
00797                         T *ptr;
00798                         size_t integer;
00799                 };
00800         };
00801         btConvertPointerSizeT converter;
00802 
00803         const size_t bit_mask = ~(alignment - 1);
00804         converter.ptr = unalignedPtr;
00805         converter.integer += alignment - 1;
00806         converter.integer &= bit_mask;
00807         return converter.ptr;
00808 }
